Header: Hong Kong protesters set barricade on fire after volleys of tear gas fired
Content: Hong Kong police fired volley after volley of tear gas to break up anti-government protesters after night fall, as protest in the China-ruled city entered its 22nd week. The protest started peacefully earlier in the day quickly spiral into chaos after police fired tear gas to disperse crowd at Victoria Park in Causeway Bay and nearby streets. The protesters took off in all directions, many throwing bricks as they charged towards Central, building makeshift barricades on the way.
